alert.note: Alert for Kern (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 20 at 5:00PM PDT until August 20 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hanford has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Kern County in central California... * Until 1100 PM PDT. * At 500 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Tehachapi, Mojave, Jawbone Canyon and Piutes. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
